item.title: Donna add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Donna add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Donna add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Donna add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Donna add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Donna add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Donna add a quote by Bill Cosby
item.description: "I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everyone." -- Bill Cosby

item.title: Donna add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "There are two kinds of teachers: the kind that fill you with so much quail shot that you can't move, and the kind that just gives you a little prod behind and you jump to the skies." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Donna add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Donna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Donna add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Donna add a quote by James Michener
item.description: "I love writing. I love the swirl and swing of words as they tangle with human emotions." -- James Michener

item.title: Donna add a quote by alice walker
item.description: "I think it pisses God off if you walk by the color purple in a field somewhere and don't notice it." -- alice walker

item.title: Donna add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere." -- Lois Lowry
